div.noscript: Please enable Javascript when viewing video pages.

td.br: Notice is hereby given that the Wall Township Board of Education will conduct a Remote Special Meeting on Sunday, April 26, 2020. The meetings will commence at 7:00 p.m. to allow the Board to meet in Executive Session, which is not open to the public. The purpose of this meeting pertains to Personnel matters. No action will be taken.

td.a: Public Hearing of the 2020/2021 School Budget: April 28th
td.br: Notice is hereby given that the Wall Township Board of Education will conduct a remote Special Meeting on Tuesday, April 28, 2020, at 6:15 p.m. This meeting pertains to the annual Budget Hearing to present and approve the 2020/2021 School Year Budget. Action will be taken.

td.a: All Wall Public School Fields & Facilities Closed!
td.br: In keeping with Governor Murphy's "Stay at Home" and Social Distancing orders, all Wall Public School fields and facilities are closed for public use until further notice.

Dear Families: On Thursday, April 16th, Governor Murphy announced that the possibility of schools being reopened will not be revisited until at least May 15th. We will remain in our virtual learning environment until further notice. As we enter Week 5 of our remote instructional plan, we have made some adjustments to provide greater opportunities for student engagement and meaningful learning, including required live and recorded lessons each week.

Beginning April 20, 2020, the following are the guidelines for Phase II of PreK-12 virtual instruction during school closure. Please click on the link below to view WTPS 2020 PreK-12 Virtual Instructional Plan.
Parents/Guardians: 2020-2021 Kindergarten registration continues via email. Please view the information below for registration details.

td.a: Support WHS DELTA Leadership Club T-Shirt Fundraiser!
td.br: The Wall High School DELTA Leadership Club is sponsoring a #ShoreQuaranTEENS t-shirt fundraiser to help support those who are helping others during this unprecedented time in our lives. These t-shirts demonstrate the Jersey Shore's universal support and unity for those who are on the front lines, as well as supporting our neighbors during this extended Stay-At-Home status.

Due to the COVID-19 School Closures, we have extended the application deadline for the Visual & Performing Arts Academy to Thursday, April 30, 2020. Please complete and submit the paper portion of the application digitally. Any required letters of recommendation can also be sent to Dr. York electronically. We will not be hosting auditions for the VPA Music or Visual Arts Majors this year. All students will be notified of acceptance on Monday, May 4, 2020, based purely on the paper application.

div.p: The mission of the Wall Township Public Schools is to empower all students to lead lives of fulfillment and purpose by providing a safe, comprehensive and caring educational environment that will enable students to achieve their unique potential academically, socially and emotionally. Our students will become confident, creative and critical thinkers who communicate effectively and engage meaningfully as responsible members of a global society.
